text: I think this is something that's so
important when you're new Dev well
everybody in the world is the most
important person to them right I think
that is just a true thing and yeah what
you have to realize as new Dev is that
your manager wants to help you unless
you're dealing with a toxic manager
right and I'm going to set that aside
right like let's assume you found
someone who actually wants to help you
but they're busy and so coming into
first of all asking for a one to one
which is for your listeners who might
not be familiar with is just like a
weekly bi-weekly regular meeting and
it's can be you know you could do it
with 10 minutes that's probably a little
short in my mind shouldn't be an hour
like 30 minutes is kind of The Sweet
Spot but it's a regular check-in and you
as the new devb should manage that like
your manager will come with things but
you should think about what you want to
communicate to your manager what you
want from your manager how to
communicate your challenges and not just
your challenges but like what you've
done to address those challenges and
you're building that relationship with
your manager so that when tough times
come or when they have new
opportunities they think of you right so
you're opening up those communication
lines and the important thing is again
not all new devs are right out of school
but when you're in school you know the
curriculum is fed to you when you're in
school the teacher has a responsibility
to take care of you and a manager is not
the same as a teacher and you need to be
very aware of that actually actually one
of my other popular posts is there are
no adults in the room which is was a
little disturbing to me when I when I
realized it but I think I came out of
school and I had the idea that like
someone knew stuff right right like you
walk into a business and people know how
to know that they know how to solve
these problems and that may be true in a
um kind of a relatively static business
with like a really good lineage and all
I can say is I've never been in one of
those companies all the software
companies I've been in people are
discovering new problems and solving new
problems all the time and that basically
means you look you look around and like
people may have more experience than you
but you're all the adults in the room
and you all need to take responsibility
towards solving those
problems
